description: From Latin calcis (“genitive singular of calx (chalk, limestone)”)  +‎ -gerous (“bearing”); compare calciferous.

adjectives.description: calcigerous (comparative more calcigerous, superlative most calcigerous)

examples: These calcigerous tubes do not run in a straight line, but their general tendency is a curvature upwards, and, in addition to which, each line or tube is distinctly waved in itself.
